revised_title: Microbial Membrane Transport Systems: The Melibiose/Na Symporter
tldr: This article investigates the microbial membrane transport system of Escherichia coli, specifically the melibiose/Na symporter. The study examines the role of the co-transported cation in the coupling mechanism and analyzes the effects of different cations on sugar-binding activity and facilitated diffusion reactions. The results suggest that the coupling cation not only activates sugar-binding but also regulates the rate of dissociation of co-substrates in the cytoplasm. The melibiose permease is identified as a membrane protein, and site-directed mutagenesis is used to explore the functional contribution of histidine residues to the symport mechanism.
